pros: An organization that truly stands by it mission statement and embodies the staff
cons: Sure there’s hardships, but it’s nothing that can’t be worked out!

pros: None anymore, I no longer remember why I wanted to work here
cons: This place is run by people who just have no idea what they're doing. Not even a little bit. But they think they do. Constant turn over. Constant utter chaos behind the scenes.

pros: Place to start career and grow
cons: No room to move up in rank. Limited amount of skills to be used. Over worked. Under paid.

review_title: If you are desperate! If you have options, RUN FAR AWAY
job_title: Call Center Agent in Raleigh, NC
pros: No pros except direct deposit and there were several occasions that was sketchy
cons:
Toxic treatment among staff. Top heavy leadership. 
Poor understanding or ability to promote team confidence and cohesive esprit de corps in call center or any other department that I could see. Constant Turnover.  
Slow to provide clear guidance but quick to chastise if errors are made.
Mistreatment of staff with disabilities.
Zero inclusion, Diversity and Equity training. 
Fast food Medicine.

pros: Great benefits for licensed providers
cons: The communication from leaders remains poor.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Raleigh, NC
pros: Absolutely none at all . PERIOD
cons: Train you in one dept. but have you in others .

review_title: New Leadership Needing to Change Company Reputation
pros: Training; Work/Family Balance; Improved Morale
cons: High Turnover Rate; Pay; Understaffed; Career Advancements

job_title: EHR Systems Administrative in Raleigh, NC
pros: New Epic Implementation for EHR
cons: Employee turnover is very high.

job_title: Director of Human Resources in Raleigh, NC
pros: Great opportunities ahead for organization.
cons: Some people have left without seeing the company potential.

job_title: HCH Drug Assistance Coordinator in Raleigh, NC
pros: The only positive things I can say about this place is the patient interaction and population. I enjoy my coworkers as well. The PTO accrual was actually decent.
cons: so much to type......ALL of the big wig administrators are so impersonable. I didn't k ow who the CEO was until 6 months into my position. She didn't introduce herself nor does she speak. The only time you see her or hear from.her is when someone comes with a site visit lookong to invest money into the org. Then she speaks...barely.The COO is even worse he just walks around with his coffee and tie with his nose in the air. The turnover rate is beyond ridiculous. Patients constantly complain about having to see different providers when they come. I've gone through 3 managerS, 1practice administrator, 4 receptionist, 1 RN, 2 NP, and 6 MD. No annual raises are given. If you need a job to pass time until you find another job this is the perfect place. I've been looking since I was hired!!! They are building a new building and asking the employees to contribute from their already small pay checks. You work over 40 hours but can't get OT...if you go over they send you home or adjust your timecard! Training is horrible for new employees.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Du Bois, IL
pros: There are no pros to working here—Run
cons: The organization is disorganized. The administrators are profit driven and don’t take into account employee satisfaction. The current staff are used and abused bc they refuse to hire more help. None of the staff are properly trained to work there excluding providers. Orientation was a joke. Turnover is extremely high bc they don’t do what it takes to retain employees.  They don’t require certification for medical assistants which seems concerning. Any decent licensed professional wouldn’t last here long bc they have no idea what they are doing. Patients decide to go elsewhere for care daily even ones who have good doctors bc the structure and organization is horrible. Last but not least, instead of fixing problems or listening to people with good ideas if you come to them and tell them what the issues are they try to push you out of the organization instead of fixing those problems. They will never be able to keep “good” staff. The people that work there for years are ok with providing mediocre services. They lie and put on fronts when visitors come. Patients deserve better, employees deserve better. The best decision I’ve made was deciding to leave this organization.

pros: Most of the employees are there for the right reasons.  Hard working people from the clinical staff to the administrative staff.  Good mission of helping the community.
cons: Too much instability and constant change.  Financial concerns and high turnover.  Biggest problem by far is the lack of leadership from the CEO.

review_title: Very disappointed in an organization that was formed for all the right reasons.
pros: The staff at the sites who were committed to provide healthcare to the uninsured or underinsured. The medical services provided are very much needed in the community.
cons:
The CEO has poor judgment, lacks in very basic leadership skills and is self serving.  Although the staff and community are clearly disappointed in her performance, she remains in the position.  There are many talented compassionate staff in the organization who are not recognized or listened to.  

The continued high provider and staff turnover is a direct result of the dissatisfaction that prevails in the organization.  When will the Board take heed?

pros: None, and its very sad!
cons: Management, out dated equipment, the "we are moving to make changes" syndrome. My trainer used profanity while window was open. Talked about the nurses staff in front of patients. I told top management, she states, well did you tell your concerns to her manager. Ummm...Im telling you. No wonder she was so comfortable doing, she knew it was nothing going to come of it. Sad!

pros: The paycheck was a broken bridge to get me over.
cons: I thank God that I was able to walk away from such a HORRIBLE company on August 16. I was blessed to walk away from the company, NOT the company to walk away from me. I regret the time I wasted to apply.  The communication within Advance Community Health,  from CEO to the janitor is less than sufficient.  The way this "organization" treats it's employees is disappointing. A person living on the street would do better collecting cans, than to work for such a place. During my time there, I can't recall 1 example of fair treatment, show of respect,  or a touch of professionalism from "management". Good luck and God speed to anyone who is hired or employed with Advance.

review_title: Undergoing a change to focus on staff, and the needs of the providers to optimize the care of the  community.
pros: Good orientation, good salary w solid benefits.  They see how you are doing regularly and genuinely seem focused on everyone being  important all having a voice to improve care delivery
cons: None. It can get busy at ROck Quarry FM.  Some patient care is complicated and takes more time and patience.

pros:
- Good place if you need some quick cash - they will hire anyone since turnover (provider, clinical, and professional) is 40-60% per year
- Located near downtown Raleigh, parking is free
cons:
- Senior management runs a mom and pop shop and doesn't understand how a business should be run
- poor profitibility in spite of a high insured patient mix, the best per visit medicaid payment in the triangle, and lucrative federal grants. That means no raises, no bonuses, no promotions, and constant job fear
- high employee stress factor - constantly understaffed and directed to work on pointless projects since senior management doesn't know how to create value

pros: Taking care of patients that have no access to healthcare otherwise.
cons: Senior management has been there too long and has burned many community bridges that are essential for continued success of the organization.  Lots of favoritism and little tolerance for change suggestions if not introduced by senior management.

pros: People I worked with were great. Other assistants were awesome. Fairly lenient leave policy.  There really aren’t any more pros.
cons: I was lied to about salary. Was told if I got Nitrous Oxide Certification I would make $1 more an hour. Conditions are grueling,, 10 hour days. I was encouraged to take 10 minute lunch. I had to take PTO for snow days and days equipment was malfunctioning and clinic closed. Supplies are limited, Management did nothing to help except to tell us to deal with it. Over booked patients. Dud I say grueling.

review_title: The highest HR turnover that I've ever seen
job_title: Human Resources Manager in Raleigh, NC
pros: The company has a great vision, but unable to execute it.
cons: Poor senior management and the board is not paying attention

pros: Has the potential to be a great place to work. Many employees are dedicated and hardworking.
cons: Senior management are egotistical and don't seem to care about the community or employees. They sit behind locked doors and are unapproachable and disconnected.  The Executive Director is not very friendly,  in fact she's quite nasty to those who she seems to view as being beneath her.

pros: Ability to provide healthcare to the underserved population.
cons: Senior Management is very incompetent. Decisions are not made in consideration of all. Financial problem caused unstableness as well as the inability to staff centers appropriately. Administration is top heavy and centers are struggling. Staffing instability throughout entire organization.

pros: mission, manager, flexibility, not micromanaged, always encouraged to grow
cons: stress, understaffed, benefits get cut each year

pros: great mission serving the community
cons: Has a high staff turnover

cons: Management doesn't listen or care about you
